page.title: 09Religion Thornley Knowle Grn
page.content:
There are two churches; Lee House, Thornley and the Congregational Church at Knowle Green. People within the area also worship at Longridge, Chipping and Ribchester and some people from outside the area attend the two churches. Non-christian religions are not represented.
Lee House derives its name from the time when Roman Catholic services were forbidden by law and the building dates from 1827. It is part of the Diocese of Salford, but Franciscans and Dominicans have been responsible for it in the past.
Knowle Green Church was built in 1867 but founded in 1831. Attendance from a wide area is regularly over 80. Events are held in the adjacent Church Hall.
